messages: 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (20:59): huh, weird
c6abb49e663030403f65db047e2cb714 (21:06): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/multipage/ seems troubled
c6abb49e663030403f65db047e2cb714 (21:07): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: annotation stuff is very cool though
c6abb49e663030403f65db047e2cb714 (21:08): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: I guess it's impossible to mark an implementation as "pass" without a testsuite first
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:14): Does non-native support count?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:15): (e.g. Excanvas)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:15): If so, who decides which non-native implementation should be counted?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:19): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: If I middle-click on the show-history link, it doesn't warn me that it's broken
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:21): no
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:21): oh, interesting
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:21): will fix once i have the multipage thing done
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:21): still can't work out why that's broken
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:22): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: Double-click to edit is not intuitive
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:23): (An "edit" link would be more obvious)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:24): It's not obvious what the "tests" or "demos" fields are meant to contain, at least when looking at an empty one

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:26): "Section status: Widely implemented" seems an odd option, since some features are widely implemented at the same time as the spec for them is a first draft (particularly when it's specifying old unstandardised features)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:29): there actually is an edit link, it's display:none
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:29): it looks ugly :-)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:29): but i can readd it i guess
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:30): though if you know that double-click adds, it's not a far jump to double-click to edit
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:31): turns stylesheets off, and sees the edit link now
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:31): The editing UI is not so good without stylesheets, though
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:31): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: Oh, double-click adds?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:31): yeah
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:32): The double-click to add behaviour is not intuitive ;-)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:32): yeah
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:32): not sure how to do it better
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:33): What is the scope of annotations? (Are they on <h3>s or something?)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:34): they look at whereever you double click, and find the first element above it to have an id
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:34): which will typically be an <hx>
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:34): first element child of body
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:36): doesn't know if it'd be too distracting to have a little edit link beside each possible annotatable location
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (21:37): s/edit/add/
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:40): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: i think having it non-intuitive is ok, the people who should be editing it can be told what the ui is
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:40): it's not hard to explain
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:40): multipage is back up
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:40): but for some reason the annotations aren't showing up
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:00): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: as far as i can tell, the middle click of a link does give the warning
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:00): well, error
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:08): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: Not in Opera 9.2
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:08): probably a bug in opera
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:08): (Also the Safari icon doesn't work in Opera)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:11): if you have any suggestions for changes to the section status options, let me know
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:11): afk lunch
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (22:24): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: it would help if the annotation UI highlighted the part of spec being annotated. I can't figure the scope of an annotation
